titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller (Nelson A.) photographs, Gubernatorial Press Office, Series 4
A Guide to the Nelson A. Rockefeller photographs, Gubernatorial Press Office, Series 4 FA457

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-12-12 00:17:59 -0500.

did.unittitle: Nelson A. Rockefeller photographs, Gubernatorial Press Office, Series 4

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: For other Nelson A. Rockefeller photographic holdings, please see the following finding aids:

FA455 Nelson A. Rockefeller photographs, Room 5600, Rockefeller family office, Series 2

FA460 Nelson A. Rockefeller photographs, Unprocessed photographs, Series 7

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: Permission is required in order to publish or otherwise use photographs and other visual materials of living members of the Rockefeller family. See RAC Head of Reference for details.
Images of Happy Rockefeller while she is officially serving as the First Lady of New York or as the Second Lady of the United States are open for scholarly use.
RAC users must abide by all applicable provisions of United States copyright law.

fileplan.head: File Plan note
fileplan.p: Nelson A. Rockefeller Gubernatorial records are formerly classified as III 15.
Notations to RG 15 are used in this collection guide. If/when the notations in this guide are revised, an updated version of the guide will be made available for scholarly access.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processing Level 1. Basic processing has been conducted to gain initial intellectual and physical control of the material. Records remain as received, in original folders and original record cartons.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: The Nelson A. Rockefeller photographs are arranged in the following series:

Series 1008: Nelson A. Rockefeller family. Series 2: Room 5600, Rockefeller family office. Series 3: Gubernatorial Press Office. Series 4: Gubernatorial Press Office. Series 5: Gubernatorial, Robert A. (Bob) Wands. Series 6: Vice Presidential. Series 7: Unprocessed photographs.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Rockefeller family photographic holdings are arranged into the following series:

Rockefeller family and Avery family photographs, Series 1001. William Avery Rockefeller family photographs, Series 1002. John D. Rockefeller family photographs, Series 1003. William Rockefeller family photographs, Series 1004. John D. Rockefeller Jr. family photographs, Series 1005. Pocantico Hills photographs, Series 1006. John D. Rockefeller 3rd family photographs, Series 1007. Nelson A. Rockefeller family photographs, Series 1008. Laurance S. Rockefeller family photographs, Series 1009. David Rockefeller family photographs, Series 1010.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids note
otherfindaid.p: For other Rockefeller family photographic holdings, please see the following finding aids:

FA452 Laurance S. Rockefeller family photographs, Series 1009
FA453 David Rockefeller family photographs, Series 1010

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The following is a guide, by month, of events photographed during the 1970 Rockefeller Gubernatorial Campaign. Events were photographed consecutively beginning April 21 and running through election night on November 3rd.
One important set of photographs, The Rochester Republican State Nominating Convention of April 6, was produced by Wide World Photos. Proof sheets are in our archives.

During the week of August 10 through 15, the Governor attended an outstanding variety of events. That week was selected as "A Week in the Life of the Governor During Campaign". Many important & exciting photographs are contained in these proofs & one complete set is located separately.
Unless otherwise specified, all photography has been performed by Bob Wands, Official Campaign Photographer for Governor Rockefeller.
Special assignments by B&G International and by Wide World Photos are listed separately.
All campaign 1970 negatives are held by B&G International.
